Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 24th overall pick, by Boston (UBA) in 1965...
Traded from Boston (UBA) to Lynchburg on 3/2/1965 (Going to LYN: P N. Rix, CF W. Tam. Going to PIL: 2B P. Landeros)...
Had first career hit on 4/4/1968, off Julius Bak (GHG)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/8/1968, off Frank Brey (PON)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Leftfield in 1968...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/19/1970, hitting .483 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Hit 3 homeruns against West Texas, driving in 7 runs on 9/21/1973...
Drove in 6 runs against Coney Island on 6/19/1974...
Won Batter of the Month award on 7/1/1974, hitting .303 with 8 HR, 24 RBI...
Injured on 7/31/1975 with a Strained Rib Cage Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1976, hitting .478 with 3 HR, 6 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Pittsburgh on 2/16/1978 to a 5-year deal worth $4,800,000 per year...
Won World Championship with Pittsburgh in 1978...
Won World Championship with Pittsburgh in 1981...
Signed as a free agent by Capital City on 2/1/1983 to a 3-year deal worth $2,448,600 per year...
Injured on 6/24/1984 with a Pinched Nerve Neck, out for 6 days...
